title: Act 2012 (No. 28 of 2012) (as adapted by the Further and Higher Education,
heading: 1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Qualifications and Quality
text_raw:
1. (1) These Regulations may be cited as the Qualifications and Quality 
Assurance (Education and Training) Act 2012 (International Education Mark 
Annual Charge) Regulations 2024. 

(2) These Regulations come into operation on 1 September 2024.
text_norm: 1 (1) regulation may cited qualification quality assurance (education training) act 2012 (international education mark annual charge) regulation 2024 (2) regulation come operation 1 september 2024

title: Act 2012 (No. 28 of 2012) (as adapted by the Further and Higher Education,
heading: In these Regulations:
text_raw:
2. 

In these Regulations: 

“Act” means the Qualifications and Quality Assurance (Education and Training) 
Act 2012 (No. 28 of 2012); 

“Authority” means the Qualifications and Quality Assurance Authority of 
Ireland established under the Act; 

“English Language Provider” means a provider that has satisfied the Authority 
that it is in compliance with the Code of Practice for the Provision of 
Programmes of English Language Education to International Learners 
established by the Authority under section 60 of the Act; 

“Higher Education Provider” means a provider that has satisfied the Authority it 
is in compliance with the Code of Practice for the Provision of Programmes of 
Higher Education to International Learners established by the Authority under 
section 60 of the Act; 

“learner week number” in respect of an English Language Provider for any week, 
means the total number of international learners to whom English language 
education and training is provided for a minimum of 15, 60-minute, scheduled 
programme hours in that week; 

“annual total learner weeks” in respect of an English Language Provider for a 
year is calculated by adding together the learner week number for each week that 
ends in that year;

title: Act 2012 (No. 28 of 2012) (as adapted by the Further and Higher Education,
heading: 3. The annual charge in respect of authorisation to use the international
text_raw:
3. The annual charge in respect of authorisation to use the international 
education mark payable by a Higher Education Provider shall be calculated in 
accordance with the total number of international learners enrolled on 
programmes of education and training leading to awards that are included within 

Notice of the making of this Statutory Instrument was published in 
"Iris Oifigiúil" of 3rd September, 2024. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [429] 3 

the National Framework of Qualifications provided by the provider in that year 
as follows: 

(1) Where the number is less than 200, the annual charge shall be €2,000; 

(2) Where the number is more than 199 but less than 1,000, the annual charge 

shall be €6,000; 

(3) Where the number is more than 999 but less than 4,000, the annual charge 

shall be €12,000; 

(4) Where the number is more than 3,999, the annual charge shall be 

€20,000.

title: Act 2012 (No. 28 of 2012) (as adapted by the Further and Higher Education,
heading: 4. The annual charge in respect of authorisation to use the international
text_raw:
4. The annual charge in respect of authorisation to use the international 
education mark payable by an English Language Provider shall be calculated in 
accordance with the annual total number of learner weeks, as follows: 

(1) Where the annual total number of learner weeks is less than 5,000, the 

annual charge shall be €2,000; 

(2) Where the annual total number of learner weeks is more than 4,999 but 

less than 15,000, the annual charge shall be €6,000; 

(3) Where the annual total number of learner weeks is more than 14,999 but 

less than 25,000, the annual charge shall be €12,000; 

(4) Where the annual total number of learner weeks is more than 24,999, the 

annual charge shall be €20,000. 

GIVEN under my Official Seal, 

28 August, 2024. 

PATRICK O'DONOVAN, 

Minister for Further and Higher Education, Research, 
Innovation and Science. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 
 4 [429]

title: Act 2012 (No. 28 of 2012) (as adapted by the Further and Higher Education,
heading: (This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal
text_raw:
EXPLANATORY NOTE 

(This note is not part of the Instrument and does not purport to be a legal 
interpretation.) 

These Regulations prescribe the annual charge to be paid to the Authority, 
Quality and Qualifications Ireland, by each provider who is authorised to use the 
international education mark, in relation to that authorisation to use the mark. 

 
 
 
 
 
 
 [429] 5
